p:
Several empirical studies in the Arctic provide evidence of the influence of climate change in increasing concentrations of POPs in polar bears
6 and mercury in sea birds
17 . Conversely, some field contributions have shown that concentrations of many legacy POPs have decreased in food webs of seabirds or exhibited a lack of increase in polar bear populations
6 . While MeHg concentrations are increasing, the decrease in POPs has been attributed to shifts in diets and in trophic position, and the phase-out of some POPs (i.e., PCBs, DDTs) in the late 1970s
6, 28 . The model projections for MeHg are also consistent with the outcomes of a climate change-mercury bioaccumulation EwE-model, involving Atlantic cod ( Gadus morhua) and pilot whales ( Globicephala melas)
26 .
